intro: Calosacme, commonly known as the "flowering grass" or "false grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, blade-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The genus includes several species, many of which are found in arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. Calosacme plants typically have a basal rosette of leaves and produce inflorescences that are either spike-like or panicle-like. These plants are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
